com.nothingworksright.fragmentboss

Class FragmentBoss

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nothingworksright.fragmentboss.FragmentBoss

  • public class FragmentBoss
extends java.lang.Object
    FragmentBoss is a library module for Android. The methods in this library make use of the android.support.v4.app Android API classes, such as the Fragment, FragmentManager, and FragmentTransaction. Some methods use a handler that runs on the UI thread.
    See Also:
    Fragment, FragmentManager, FragmentTransaction

    • Method Detail

      • replaceFragmentInContainer

        public static void replaceFragmentInContainer(int containerViewId,
                                              android.support.v4.app.FragmentManager fm,
                                              android.support.v4.app.Fragment fragment,
                                              java.lang.String tagCombo)
        Called to replace a fragment in a container. Uses the fragment tag to identify unique fragments. Uses a handler that's running on the UI thread. This is the primary method of the FragmentBoss class. This method could be used any time a fragment needs to be placed into a container. If a fragment with a matching tag can be found in the fragment manager, it will be resurfaced by using resurfaceFragmentInBackStack(FragmentManager, String). If no matching fragment tag can be found in the fragment manager, the fragment will be added using the fragmentTransaction.replace(int containerViewId, Fragment fragment, String tag) method. The fragment tag is added to the back stack. Last, bringToFront is called on the fragment's view, to be sure that the fragment at the top of the back stack is also visible.
        Parameters:
        containerViewId - int: Identifier of the container whose fragment(s) are to be replaced.
        fm - FragmentManager: The fragment manager interface being used to interact with the fragment objects inside of the activity.
        fragment - Fragment: The fragment to be placed into the activity.
        tagCombo - String: The tagCombo is a pipe delimited string of values. Always create the tagCombo by using the tagJoiner(String, int, long) method. Always split the tagCombo by using the tagSplitter(String) method.

      • resurfaceFragmentInBackStack

        public static void resurfaceFragmentInBackStack(android.support.v4.app.FragmentManager fm,
                                                java.lang.String desiredTagCombo)
        Called by replaceFragmentInContainer(int, FragmentManager, Fragment, String) Do not call this method directly. Called to resurface a desired fragment which already exists somewhere in the back stack, without changing or losing other currently existing fragments in the back stack. Uses a handler that's running on the UI thread. First, the current back stack is replicated in an ArrayList. Next, the back stack is emptied, and all fragments are removed from the fragment manager. Next, the fragment manager and back stack are refilled from the ArrayList in order, skipping the desired fragment. Last, the desired fragment is added, leaving it at the surface.
        Parameters:
        fm - FragmentManager: The fragment manager interface being used to interact with the fragment objects inside of the activity.
        desiredTagCombo - String: The tagCombo is a pipe delimited string of values. Always create the tagCombo by using the tagJoiner(String, int, long) method. Always split the tagCombo by using the tagSplitter(String) method.

      • buryFragmentInBackStack

        public static void buryFragmentInBackStack(android.support.v4.app.FragmentManager fm,
                                           java.lang.String desiredTagCombo)
        Called to bury a fragment at the bottom of the back stack. Uses a handler that's running on the UI thread. First, the current back stack is replicated in an ArrayList. Next, the back stack is emptied, and all fragments are removed from the fragment manager. Next, the fragment manager and back stack are refilled beginning with the desired fragment, and then the remaining fragments from the ArrayList in order.
        Parameters:
        fm - FragmentManager: The fragment manager interface being used to interact with the fragment objects inside of the activity.
        desiredTagCombo - String: The tagCombo is a pipe delimited string of values. Always create the tagCombo by using the tagJoiner(String, int, long) method. Always split the tagCombo by using the tagSplitter(String) method.

      • popBackStack

        public static void popBackStack(android.support.v4.app.FragmentManager fm)
        Called to pop the top fragment off of the fragment manager's back stack. Uses a handler that's running on the UI thread.
        Parameters:
        fm - FragmentManager: The fragment manager interface being used to interact with the fragment objects inside of the activity.

      • tagJoiner

        public static java.lang.String tagJoiner(java.lang.String tagTitle,
                                         int containerViewId,
                                         long dbRecordId)
        Called to join multiple fields into a pipe delimited String.
        Parameters:
        tagTitle - String: A traditional fragment tag, a unique string used to identify a unique fragment. Used here as a fragment title.
        containerViewId - int: Identifier of the container for the fragment to be placed in.
        dbRecordId - long: A database record ID, such as a unique column or primary key value.
        Returns:
        The return value is a pipe delimited String. This is called the tagCombo.

      • tagSplitter

        public static java.lang.String[] tagSplitter(java.lang.String tagCombo)
        Called to split multiple fields from a pipe delimited String.
        Parameters:
        tagCombo - String: A pipe delimited String containing multiple values.
        Returns:
        The return value is a String array of the separated values from the tagCombo. These values are: The String which is the fragment tag title; the string value of the int which is the fragment's containerViewId.

      • findFragmentByTagTitleAndDbId

        public static android.support.v4.app.Fragment findFragmentByTagTitleAndDbId(android.support.v4.app.FragmentManager fm,
                                                                            java.lang.String desiredTagTitle,
                                                                            long desiredDbRecordId)
        Called to locate and return a fragment where the tagCombo contains matching tagTitle and dbRecordId values.
        Parameters:
        fm - FragmentManager: The fragment manager interface being used to interact with the fragment objects inside of the activity.
        desiredTagTitle - String: The first of two pipe delimited values contained in the tagCombo. The tagTitle is a traditional fragment tag, a unique string used to identify a fragment.
        desiredDbRecordId - long: A database record ID, such as a unique column or primary key value.
        Returns:
        The return value is a Fragment if a match is found, or null if no match is found.

      • removeFragmentByTagTitleAndDbId

        public static void removeFragmentByTagTitleAndDbId(android.support.v4.app.FragmentManager fm,
                                                   java.lang.String undesiredTagTitle,
                                                   long undesiredDbRecordId)
        Called to remove a fragment from the fragment manager and back stack. The fragment is located by matching on the tagTitle and dbRecordId, fields in the BackStackBoss tagCombo. Uses a handler that's running on the UI thread.
        Parameters:
        fm - FragmentManager: The fragment manager interface being used to interact with the fragment objects inside of the activity.
        undesiredTagTitle - String: The first of two pipe delimited values contained in the tagCombo. The tagTitle is a traditional fragment tag, a unique string used to identify a fragment.
        undesiredDbRecordId - long: A database record ID, such as a unique column or primary key value.

      • topFragmentOnResume

        public static void topFragmentOnResume(android.support.v4.app.FragmentManager fm)
        Called to call the onResume method in the fragment at the top of the back stack. Uses a handler that's running on the UI thread.
        Parameters:
        fm - FragmentManager: The fragment manager interface being used to interact with the fragment objects inside of the activity.
